de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.network
Class AbstractNetLayer

java.lang.Object
  de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.network.AbstractNetLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, NetLayer
Direct Known Subclasses:
GnpNetLayer, SimpleNetLayer
public abstract class AbstractNetLayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetLayer

This abstract class provides a skeletal implementation of the NetLayer interface to lighten the effort for implementing this interface.

Version:
3.0, 11/29/2007
Author:
Sebastian Kaune, Konstantin Pussep

          Adds a connectivity listener to a given NetLayer instance.
 void addNetMsgListener(NetMessageListener listener)
          Adds the given NetMessageListener as a handler for incoming NetMsgEvents triggered by the NetLayer which implements the message passing from the NetLayer to a layer above.

          Returns the current available download bandwidth of the network layer as the maximum download bandwidth might be shared between concurrently established connections.

AbstractNetLayer

public AbstractNetLayer(double maxDownBandwidth,
                        double maxUpBandwidth,
                        NetPosition position)
Abstract constructor called by a subclass of this instance

Parameters:
maxDownBandwidth - the maximum physical download bandwidth
maxUpBandwidth - the maximum physical upload bandwidth
position - the NetPosition of the network layer
Method Detail

receive

public void receive(NetMessage message)
This message is called by the subnet to deliver a new NetMessage to a remote NetLayer. (@see de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.network.AbstractSubnet). Calling this method informs further all registered NetMsgListeners about the receipt of this NetMessage using a appropriate NetMsgEvent.

Parameters:
message - The NetMessage that was received by the NetLayer.

isSupported

protected abstract boolean isSupported(TransProtocol protocol)
Return whether the required transport protocol is supported by the given NetLayer instance

Parameters:
protocol - the required transport protocol
Returns:
true if supported

setCurrentDownBandwidth

protected void setCurrentDownBandwidth(double currentDownBandwidth)
As the download bandwidth of a host might be shared between concurrently established connections, this method will be used by the subnet in order to adapt the current available download bandwidth.

Parameters:
currentDownBandwidth - the new available download bandwidth

setCurrentUpBandwidth

protected void setCurrentUpBandwidth(double currentUpBandwidth)
As the upload bandwidth of a host might be shared between concurrently established connections, this method will be used by the subnet in order to adapt the current available upload bandwidth.

Parameters:
currentUpBandwidth - the new available upload bandwidth

goOffline

public void goOffline()
Description copied from interface: NetLayer
Releases the connection to the physical network. Further to this, if installed, the correspondent ConnectivityListener will be informed about the changes in connectivity.

Specified by:
goOffline in interface NetLayer

getNetPosition

public NetPosition getNetPosition()
Description copied from interface: NetLayer
Returns the NetPosition of a host which might be represented as the position in a two-dimensional Euclidean space, as n-dimensional coordinates used in Global Network Positioning or the location on Earth which is described by two numbers--its latitude and its longitude.

Specified by:
getNetPosition in interface NetLayer
Returns:
NetPosition the appropriate position

getMaxDownloadBandwidth

public double getMaxDownloadBandwidth()
Description copied from interface: NetLayer
Returns the maximum physical upload bandwidth that is available at the given network wrapper. Thus, this value represents a state in which all download connections are closed.

Specified by:
getMaxDownloadBandwidth in interface NetLayer
Returns:
the maximum physicalupload download bandwidth

getMaxUploadBandwidth

public double getMaxUploadBandwidth()
Description copied from interface: NetLayer
Returns the maximum physical upload bandwidth that is available at the given network wrapper. Thus, this value represents a state in which all upload connections are closed.

Specified by:
getMaxUploadBandwidth in interface NetLayer
Returns:
the maximum physical upload bandwidth

addConnectivityListener

public void addConnectivityListener(ConnectivityListener listener)
Description copied from interface: NetLayer
Adds a connectivity listener to a given NetLayer instance. This should be automatically managed by the HostBuilder and the listener should be a subclass of the HostProperties interface.

Specified by:
addConnectivityListener in interface NetLayer
Parameters:
listener - the connectivity listener
